original: Kjellman, James Ferdinand, redaktör, Ljungby, f. 14/7/90 i Gbg av John K. o. Selma Flygare. G. 18 m. Signe PetteriS’Son. Barn: Åke Sigvald f. 19, Bror Östen 22. — Lärov:stud. i Här- nöisand samt tekn. o. prakt, jordbr:-utbilidn. Medarb. i Söderköp.-Posten 08-10, Hudiksvalls-Posten 16-17, Bon-detidn. 18, Dalabladet 19-24, (inneh. 23), Falu Länstidn. 24-30, Ljungbytidn. Smålänningen sed. 36. Led. av stads-fullm., sekr. i Ljungby hantv:- o. ind:-fören. Skr.: romaner o. broschyrer. Sign.: Erik Blom. Hobby: fiske. LingJubM, SHSO GM o. dipl. f. Fa-luut&tälln. 27, dess förtj :SM o. dipl. f. Ljungbyutställn. 42.
translated:
Kjellman, James Ferdinand, editor, Ljungby, born on July 14, 1890 in Gothenburg, son of John K. and Selma Flygare. Married in 1918 to Signe Pettersson. Children: Åke Sigvald, born in 1919, Bror Östen, born in 1922. 

Education: Studied in Härnösand and received technical and practical agricultural training. Worked for Söderköping-Posten from 1908 to 1910, Hudiksvalls-Posten from 1916 to 1917, Bonda-Tidningen in 1918, Dalabladet from 1919 to 1924 (including ownership in 1923), Falu Länstidning from 1924 to 1930, Ljungbytidningen Smålänningen since 1936. Member of the city council, secretary of the Ljungby Crafts and Industry Association. Wrote novels and brochures under the pen name Erik Blom. Hobby: fishing. 

Received the Ling Jubilee Medal, SHSO Gold Medal, and a diploma for the Falun Exhibition in 1927, as well as a special merit diploma for the Ljungby Exhibition in 1942.
